After wearing it for the past year, the quality of the joggers not only stood the test of time, but constant movement and repeated use. I’ve gotten regular complements on the pants, and style them one to two ways and arrange these pants with various athletic tops and shoes.  The pants themselves are not designed for exercise and dramatic movements, and the Velcro on the pockets are regularly frayed discouraging use ( I’d recommend a redesign with buttons for cost effectiveness ). Otherwise, the pants are great, have retained their color over multiple washes, and fit just as well as the first day I put them on!

The Aelfric Eden Men's Joggers proved to be a pleasant surprise, blending fashion-forward design with practical features for a comfortable and versatile wardrobe staple.  The multi-pocket design is not only trendy but also incredibly functional. The various pockets, strategically placed, provide ample space for carrying essentials, making these joggers suitable for both casual outings and outdoor activities. The attention to detail in pocket placement adds a stylish edge to the overall design.  The drawstring feature allows for a customized fit, ensuring comfort during any level of activity. The joggers strike a balance between a relaxed and tailored silhouette, making them suitable for both lounging at home and stepping out in style.  The fabric used is both soft and durable, offering a pleasant feel against the skin while standing up to the rigors of everyday wear. The joggers also maintain their shape well after multiple washes, a testament to their quality construction.  The outdoor fashion appeal is evident in the thoughtful design elements, making these joggers a versatile choice for various settings. Whether paired with a casual tee or a more polished shirt, they effortlessly elevate the overall look.  In conclusion, the Aelfric Eden Men's Joggers successfully combines comfort, style, and functionality. With their multi-pocket design, adjustable fit, and durable fabric, they cater to both fashion-conscious individuals and those seeking practicality in their everyday wear. These joggers are a commendable addition to any wardrobe, offering a modern take on casual, comfortable fashion.

评论概述: If you're going to read a review on these it should be this one
评论详情: So let me start this with this is the only pair of pants that I've bought or worn in the last 3 years. I have quite a few pairs and always eager to add more they fit me better than any pair of joggers I've ever owned and the fabric they use is spectacular and the straps on the legs are an absolute god send for anyone that really wants to utilize those cargo pockets, for my job we carry radios and I'm able to put a whole radio in one of the smaller leg pockets and the tighten down the strap and I'm able to sprint without my radio flopping all around and falling out. BUT they do come with their downsides. The thread and the velcro that is used to make these pants is absolute garbage for some reason. Velcro begins to diminish immediately on every pair, and the pockets on the legs begin to unthread themselves within a month or so of daily wear and the straps on the legs will just randomly completely come out on one side leaving a random long dangling strap sometimes right in the middle of the workday. For me though this in not much of an issue, I just replace the velcro and sew up the pockets and they're good as new. I would not be willing to do this if it weren't for the fit and quality of the fabric, to me that makes dealing with the thread and the velcro a bit easier to swallow. Plus as long as you use quality thread and velcro and not make the same mistake they did when manufacturing these then you'll probably never have to do it again which is nice, but really it shouldnt need to be done in the first place when there's literally just better quality stuff they could be using and for the price these cost you'd think they would just come with quality thread and velcro right off the bat. It's not a deal breaker for me but it could be for you.
These did not disappoint

These are by far my favorite tech/streetwear pants I've ever bought. They're made out of some sort of nylon material that is very durable, doesn't fade and dries out pretty quickly if you happen to get soaked. After 3 and half years of wear the only visible sign of wear on these is a small lining on the pocket flap that has kind of started to peel a little. Apart from that, the velcro has obviously worn out on the pockets around the thighs but they still function and I regularly use them to store my wallet and phone so I definitely still trust the pockets. like most techwear products, they feature some pretty cringe text on one of the pockets "Land Combat Group: we are the land combat group | our duty is to create the walking armor to protect our selves in the reinforced concrete forest" (yes, they wrote ourselves as two words). but after having them and wearing them regularly over the span of 3 years I can honestly say these are absolutely worth every penny. some of my equally old techwear pants are looking worse for wear and need replacing and I'm definitely considering just getting more of these.
When I opened the package i was surprised at how expensive feeling the material felt exceeding my expectations very happy with my purchase fits very well
Straps broke immediately. Very cheap feeling. Don’t sweat in these. I’ve worn these multiple times and each time I sweat, my phone in my pocket gets all wet. Avoid these pants.
These seem well made but I had to get an extra large, which is weird. I usually wear a 32 inch waist and a 30 inch inseam with my pants.

I bought this product for a dance showcase coming up. The look is cool and the size fits as expected. however, from after the waist and down, the pant feels a bit constricted if you try to do anything but walk or stand.

The fabric of the pants has zero stretch or give, and is tight in random areas. If you really want to get these pants, order a larger size than recommended. Wearing the recommended size, I couldn't lift my legs or move around easily, limiting mobility. If you only walk, stand, or sit, then these would be okay. The right side pockets (x2) look like they could hold 15 round AR mags but I didn't test it.  The straps on these pants are obviously for show, but the included hardware slides off the straps immediately, meaning you will lose it. The first time I put my hands in the pockets, I could hear stitching ripping. I think I would've been better off getting regular cargo pants from somewhere else. These pants have very little utility, and the quality is below what I would consider basic quality.

Cool, thick fabric, will edit review after I wash/try em on, so far smells like plastic but that could just be the bag they came in.  There will be grammatically incoherent writing on on side pocket, prolly translation issue, but yeah so far is cool 😎  UPDATE: Fit fine, smell better, ...the buckle things are entirely functionless, I will most likely cut those off and keep the pants, thanks, everyone have a good day 👍

I kinda figured they wouldn't fit but had to try and the pants just looked too cool. I ordered the XX-Large size those were definitely not it. I'm about 255lbs / 115 kg in weight and 5'11 in height. The pants fit so to speak if you want them hanging off of your booty cheeks a bit and are fine with not doing any serious stretching. I could walk in them fine but anything extra was a no go. If I had to guess, I'd say XXL are more for someone who's around 230lbs / 104kg or possibly less. They look and feel pretty cool but you will surely have to be a smaller size for these. And the stretchability isn't much.

These feel crazy cheap. I think they're actually pretty overpriced for the quality of material you're getting. Not even a hint of stretch. They didn't fit well either but I've got big legs so it's usually hard for me to find pants so I'm not surprised about this. Decent looking pants though! Realistically think you should either get higher quality pants and pay more or save money and pay less for equally low quality material

I ordered a size Large. It fit pretty good, but I wanted a just little bit more baggy and loose, so I thought a size XL would be perfect. When I exchanged the product and gotten the size XL, it turned out size XL was even tighter around my legs and seemed smaller, which is very unusual for me, so I just decided to return it agian and forget about it. Overall great pants if you want that skinny tight look, but for me, I like my pants loose and baggy. I would rather recommend trying before buying or go to your local stores instead. Buying clothes online is always iffy and you might experience what I've just experienced.
